education.title: Web Development Immersive
responsibilities: Completed an intensive web development immersion program, amassing over 1,000 hours of hands-on experience in building real-world business applications.
Mastered industry-standard practices such as pair programming and agile workflows, translating theoretical knowledge into practical coding skills.

projects.title: The Tipping Point

education.title: Masters of the Art of Teaching (Secondary Sciences)
responsibilities: Cultivated expertise in pedagogical principles and instructional strategies, fostering student success.
Enhanced classroom management, curriculum design, and student engagement techniques for a dynamic and effective teaching approach.
Excelled in a comprehensive program, gaining valuable insights into educational theory and practice to deliver high-quality instruction and promote student growth.

education.title: Bachelors of Arts of Studio Art
responsibilities: Spearheaded the creation, production, and presentation of diverse art shows encompassing painting, sculpture, book construction, printing, and immersive experiences during my undergraduate years at St. John's University.
Revitalized the rowing team by serving as captain, steering the organization from near-extinction to a thriving and dynamic group, demonstrating strong leadership and team-building skills.
Contributed to the vibrant campus community as a member of the improv comedy troupe 'Attention Starved Children,' showcasing creativity and humor in engaging performances.

workExperience.title: Team Lead/Software Delivery Manager
workExperience.summary: Led and cultivated a high-performing engineering team, overseeing the professional development of a diverse group comprising Senior, Mid-level, Associate, and Intern Software Engineers.
responsibilities: Guided the successful execution and delivery of multiple projects/products, including a styled XLSX and drag and drop PDF report designer with a corresponding API, an admin management console, and a comprehensive export compliance integration overhaul.
Tracked essential engineering KPIs while driving the team's Objectives and Key Results (OKRs), emphasizing both engineering excellence and positive customer outcomes.
Integrated seamlessly with various libraries and APIs to ensure cohesive system functionality.
Identified technical risks and developed requirements for architectural and high level technical design plans.

Collaborated seamlessly with multiple Product Owners to establish a clear product vision, formulated a strategic roadmap, defined precise product/UX requirements, and maintained transparent communication regarding delivery progress, impediments, and outstanding inquiries.

Devised and implemented a robust quality strategy for the team, encompassing meticulous test plan creation, extensive automated test coverage, systematic defect triage, and the implementation of quality gates during promotion stages resulting in reduced escaped defects and quicker defect resolution for customers.

Orchestrated the weekly promotion and deployment cycle, orchestrating vital steps such as product and quality approvals, automated regression testing, version updates, feature flag releases, hotfix deployments, and continuous refinement of pipeline tools for heightened promotion automation.

workExperience.title: Software Engineer
workExperience.summary: Designed, developed, and maintained cutting-edge software solutions that empower data analysts and business users to efficiently extract insights from complex data sets through the Alteryx platform.
responsibilities: Served as both a Scrum Master and an Engineer, driving the development of a charting and data profiling tool within the Windows desktop Designer product. Utilized TypeScript, React, C++, and C to deliver impactful features.
Developed MicroSDK system to introduce extensibility into Cloud Designer product.
Developed the interactive results grid table in the cloud-based Designer product, implementing TypeScript and React creating an enhanced customer experience and streamlined workflow creation.

workExperience.title: Full Stack Web Developer
workExperience.summary: Designed, implemented, and maintained interactive and visually engaging web applications that enhance user experiences and seamlessly integrate front-end interfaces with back-end functionalities.
responsibilities: Architected and led the development of Play Posit 3.0's navigation and analytics dashboard, spearheading the transformation of legacy PHP code into an efficient Vue.js microservice backed by an Express/Node.js backend and MySQL database.
Forged seamless integrations between the dashboard and various learning management systems and video hosting platforms, amplifying the reach and utility of the product.
Demonstrated technical leadership and innovation throughout the project lifecycle.

workExperience.title: Web Development Immersive

responsibilities: Completed an intensive web development immersion program, amassing over 1,000 hours of hands-on experience in building real-world business applications.

workExperience.title: Middle School Science Teacher
workExperience.summary: Combined inquiry-based activities and balanced instruction to inspire a future generation of scientists.
responsibilities: Served as the Science Department Head helping manage shared resources and foster collaboration between other teachers.
Managed school technology program including computer maintenance, screen fixes, and operational processes.
Produced a blended learning online curriculum program for Literacy, Math, and Science for students to practice and develop basic skill
Mentored peer and student teachers.

workExperience.title: Middle School Science Teacher
workExperience.summary: Led technology initiatives, supported English language learners, and oversaw extracurricular activities while serving as a science teacher at Ridgewood Middle School and Newton Smith.
responsibilities: Worked in our districts technology program and created a one-to-one iPad classroom.
Built connections within the community by hosting multiple guest speakers and developing a relationship and STEAM program with Norton Art Gallery.
Designed and built the school website, ran the school science club, offered free after school tutoring, helped coach the school robotics team, and coached cross country and girls track.
